Thanks in advance

entry.title: Authorization setup for SAC Import Model from S4 ABAP CDS Views
entry.content:
Purpose of this document

The purpose of this blog is to explain how to implement data-level authorization in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories when:

  • Data is extracted from SAP S/4HANA CDS Views
  • The connection type is Import Model
  • Authorization must be enforced based on Company Code and Plant

This approach ensures that users can access only the data they are authorized to see, even though the data is physically stored in SAC.

 

Business Use Case

In many finance and controlling scenarios:

  • A single SAC Story is shared across multiple business users
  • Users belong to different Company Codes and Plant
  • Data is periodically imported from SAP S/4HANA into SAC

Since Import Models store data in SAC, runtime authorisation from S/4HANA (CDS DCLs) is not applied. Therefore, authorization must be designed and enforced within SAC.

 

Authorization Concept for Import Models

When working with SAC Import Models, authorization is handled as follows:

Layer

Responsibility

SAP S/4HANA CDS

Defines which data is extracted

SAC Model

Enforces row-level data authorization

SAC Story

Automatically respects model-level security

Key points to note:
  • CDS DCLs are evaluated only at data extraction time
  • SAC Data Access Control (DAC) governs user visibility
  • Story designers do not need to manage authorization logic
Example Used in This Blog

The same example is used consistently throughout the blog.

Attribute

Value

Authorization Dimensions

Company Code, Plant

Sample Company Code

0100

Sample Plant

RA01, RA02, …

SAC Connection Type

Import

Source System

SAP S/4HANA CDS View

 

Step-by-Step Authorization Setup

Step 1: Prepare CDS View in SAP S/4HANA

Ensure that the CDS View contains the fields required for authorization, i.e., Company Code and Plant.

Example CDS Used:

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZCDEMO002V'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Demo Authorization Consumption VIew'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@Analytics.query: true
@VDM.viewType: #CONSUMPTION
define view ZC_DEMO_AUTH_2
  as select from ZI_DEMO_AUTH_1
{
  PurchaseOrder,
  PurchaseOrderItem,
  PurchaseOrderCategory,
  CompanyCode, // Authorization field
  Plant,       // Authorization Field
  @Semantics.currencyCode: true
  DocumentCurrency,
  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'DocumentCurrency'
  PurOrderNetAmount
}

Important notes:

  • Authorization-relevant fields must be part of the CDS output
  • CDS DCLs are not used for runtime authorization in SAC Import Models

 

Step 2: Create Import Model in SAP Analytics Cloud

  • Navigate to Connections in SAC.
  • Create an SAP S/4HANA Import Connection.
  • Import the CDS View as a Model.

  • At this stage, the data is physically stored in SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

Step 3: Enable Data Access Control (DAC)

  • Open the imported Model
  • Navigate to Settings
  • Navigate to Model Preferences
  • Enable Data Access Control

  • This step activates row-level authorization for the model.

 

Step 4: Mark Authorization-Relevant Dimensions

  • Enable data access control for the required dimensions.
  • Select CompanyCode, and Plant.

  • These dimensions are now evaluated during data access.

 

Step 5: Create Data Access Roles

  • Navigate to Security → Data Access
  • Create a new Data Access Role

  • Provide Role information, Role template, and review before creating. Template helps to create roles fast for general sections like BI Admin or Planner. In this we will choose template as ‘Blank’.

  • After role is created, we will move to ‘Select Model’, choose your import model.

  • Select dimensions required for authorizations and provide values for each.

 

Step 6: Assign Data Access Role to Users

  • Navigate to Security → Roles
  • Select the relevant user
  • Assign Business Role – SAC_ROLE_DEMO_001 to users for Row-level authorization.
  • The user now inherits Company Code and Plant restrictions.

 

Step 7: Validate Authorization in SAC Story

  • Create or open a Story based on the model.
  • Add a table or chart in story for validation.
  • Include Company Code and Plant as dimensions.
  • Authorization is automatically enforced at runtime.

 

Results

After completing the setup:

  • Data visibility is restricted at row level.
  • A single Story can be reused for multiple user groups.
  • No duplication of Stories or Models is required.
  • Authorization is centrally managed in SAC.
  • Import performance remains unchanged.

 

Best Practices

  • Enable Data Access Control immediately after model creation.
  • Use consistent authorization dimensions across models.
  • Follow clear and business-aligned naming conventions for roles.
  • Do not rely on CDS DCLs for Import Model security.
  • Always validate authorization using multiple test users.

 

Conclusion

When working with SAP Analytics Cloud Import Models based on SAP S/4HANA CDS Views, authorization must be implemented within SAC.

By using:

  • Data Access Control
  • Authorization-enabled dimensions
  • Data Access Roles

you can achieve secure, scalable, and reusable Story-level authorization based on Company Code and Plant fully aligned with standard SAP practices.

entry.title: Re: Fill automatically the purchase org and group field in freight order
entry.content: Dear Sumit, Thank you for your feedback, I am also adding here the feedback from Question: Purchasing organization & Purchasing group determination in Freight order https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-q-a/purchasing-organization-amp-purchasing-group-determination-in-freight-order/qaq-p/14038948#M203319. -> Currently, there is no option to directly determine the purchasing organization and purchasing group in a Freight order based on certain conditions. I recommend you to consider implementing API for Freight Order (A2X) to update the Purchasing organization and Purchasing group. As soon the Freight order is created, based on Freight order event, you can trigger the API to update the Purchasing organization and Purchasing group.

entry.title: Which SAP IAS tenant should be used for SAP BTP when configuring Joule in S/4HANA Cloud Public?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently working on the configuration of Joule for a project running on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and we have an architecture-related question regarding Identity Authentication Service (IAS).

In our landscape, we have:

  • One IAS Test tenant

  • One IAS Productive tenant

As part of the Joule setup, we also have an SAP BTP tenant included in the project.

Our question is:

Which IAS tenant should be connected to the SAP BTP tenant when implementing Joule?

  • Should SAP BTP be trusted with the IAS Test tenant, or

  • Is it considered best practice to connect SAP BTP directly to the IAS Productive tenant?

Additionally, we would like to understand:

  • What is the recommended SAP best practice for this scenario?

  • Is there a typical approach during implementation phases (test vs. productive)?

  • Are there any considerations specific to S/4HANA Cloud Public + Joule that we should be aware of?

Any guidance, official documentation references, or real-project experience would be greatly appreciated.
We are especially interested in SAP-recommended architectures or official guidance for S/4HANA Cloud Public projects.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Oscar

entry.title: Licnese Service not generating HK on AWS EC2 win2022 , SBO 10.0 SP2511 , mssql 2019
entry.content:
SAP Business One License Service not generating Hardware Key (HK) on AWS EC2

We are facing an issue where the SAP Business One License Service does not generate a Hardware Key (HK).

Environment details:

  • SAP Business One: 10.0 SP 2511

  • Database: MS SQL Server 2019

  • OS: Windows Server 2022

  • Infrastructure: AWS EC2

The License Service starts successfully, but no HK is generated, preventing license assignment.

Has anyone encountered this issue on AWS EC2 / virtualized environments, especially with Windows Server 2022?
Are there specific prerequisites, patches, or AWS-related configurations required for HK generation?

Any insights or guidance would be appreciated.

entry.title: Advanced Returns (RMA) Across Two Plants / Two Company Codes
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I’m looking for insights from anyone who has already implemented the Advanced Returns (RMA) process across two plants belonging to two different company codes.

Context: We need to manage customer returns (RMA) in the following scenario :

  • The customer returns the material to Plant A (Company Code A).

  • If the material cannot be repaired in Plant A, we need to transfer it to Plant B (Company Code B).

  • Plant B performs the repair and then ships the repaired material directly back to the customer.

We would like to know :

  • Is this cross‑company, cross‑plant RMA scenario supported in Advanced Returns Management ?

  • What configuration steps or prerequisites are required to make this work ?

  • Do you have any documentation, best practices, or experience to share ?

Thank you in advance for your help and ideas !

entry.title: Re: An End-to-End Hands-On Tutorial for Clean Core RAP Development
entry.content:
Thank you for sharing!

I agree this is a well-structured and probably most reasonable content on the subject we've seen lately. Just some feedback.

1. I'm confused what this has to do with "Clean Core". This is all completely custom development. It doesn't touch the "core", nothing is being or will be extended here. It's technically not wrong, but one could simply remove any clean core mentioning from the post and it would not change any meaning. 

2. I wish SAP would finally get their stuff together on the educational content and put some strategy around it, once and for all. There is a separate website developers.sap.com, which is supposed to contain the actual tutorials. The tutorials there always had a problem that they give you the steps but don't explain why the steps are needed. Which this blog post provides. Why can't the two be finally combined? Then we could finally have true tutorials, with all the tutorial features (such as tracking progress, accomplishments, and links to other content) and the explanation like in this post?

I invite everyone at SAP to read this post, annually. It was written in 2022 but remains valid in what is almost 2026.

entry.title: Re: Extract Document details using Document Information Extraction service with ABAP
entry.content:
Commenting for other people's future benefit

This is a great blog. Myself and couple of colleagues implemented this for a customer.
The biggest pain point for us was to Call the API URL directly.

The below method call did not allow us to get the response back in case of premium BTP version.

cl_http_client=>create_by_url

So we created another RFC destination for the API URL (Example below) without any authentication

aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com

And called this URL in the code with oauth authorization dynamically in code.
It worked like magic.

entry.title: Re: SAP Office Tables and Workflow Items
entry.content: Workflow inbox items are mainly stored in workflow tables, not classic SAPoffice tables. Key tables include SWWWIHEAD (work item header), SWWUSERWI (user assignments), SWWLOGHIST (history), and SWW_CONT / SWW_CONTOB (container data). For cleanup and size control, SAP‑recommended programs are RSWWWIDE (delete completed work items) and transaction SWWL for workflow administration. SAPoffice tables like SOOD, SOC3, SOFFCONT1 are cleaned using RSBCS_REORG, but workflow data itself is not fully removed by SAPoffice reorg programs.

entry.title: Re: changing the stats_change_threshold value from the de...
entry.content: There is no strict rule of thumb to change stats_change_threshold from the default 50%. SAP generally recommends keeping it unchanged unless there is a proven performance issue. If statistics are too old for very large or frequently changing tables, you can temporarily lower the threshold (for example to 25%) or collect statistics explicitly for specific tables using BRCONNECT or DB20. Any change should be carefully evaluated, as lowering the threshold increases runtime and may impact system performance.

entry.title: Re: Attachment for a Purchase Order !
entry.content:
Create Attachment uploads the document into SAP (stored in SAPoffice tables like SOFFCONT1, unless a Content Server is configured).
Create External Document (URL) only stores a link, not the file itself.

SAP does not recommend storing large documents in the OLTP database; instead, use a Content Server configured via OAC0/OAC3.

For programmatic attachments to a PO, there is no direct PO BAPI. Attachments are handled via GOS, typically using SO_OBJECT_INSERT_API1, or via DMS with BAPI_DOCUMENT_CREATE2, then linking the document to the PO.

entry.title: Re: In rz20 showing red
entry.content:
The alert turns red because a segment has exceeded the configured extent threshold. In your case it’s a LOB segment (SOFFCONT1).
For LOB segments, online reorg is limited; the usual approach is to move/rebuild the LOB (e.g. ALTER TABLE … MOVE LOB …) or reorganize via SAP‑recommended tools during downtime. Also review and adjust the RZ20 threshold if it’s too low.

entry.title: Re: dump in Segment builder (urgent)
entry.content: Solution: This dump is caused by duplicate keys during member intersection in CRM Segment Builder. The issue is resolved by implementing SAP Note 1061302, which fixes the duplicate handling in FM CRM_MKTTG_MEMBER_TAB_INTERSECT. After applying the note, the profile set can be created without dumps.

entry.title: Re: Error reorg table with brspace
entry.content:
This error is usually not caused by BRSPACE options. In this case it was due to an Oracle patch not being linked correctly.

Fix:

  1. Stop SAP, database, and listener

  2. Log in as ora<SID>

  3. Run relink all

  4. Start SAP again

After relinking, the online reorg with BRSPACE worked fine. Also make sure the required SAP bundle patches and Oracle scripts (catalog.sql / catproc.sql) are correctly applied.

entry.title: Re: MESSAGE_TYPE_X dump in RSBCS_REORG (SAPLSZA0 READ_DB_ADDRESS)
entry.content: Thanks for the input. Running Z_OSSNOTE_436119 and checking ADCP for blank address numbers resolved the MESSAGE_TYPE_X dump in RSBCS_REORG. Appreciate the help.

entry.title: Re: GOS 'Create Attachment' - Can we archive it to DMS?
entry.content:
In standard SAP, GOS “Create Attachment” cannot be routed to DMS or a Content Server.
Attachments created via GOS are always stored in the SAP database tables (SOFFCONT1 / SOC3).

If you want documents to be stored outside the DB:

  • Use “Store Business Document” with Content Server configuration, or

  • Disable Create Attachment (as you already did), or

  • Implement a custom ABAP solution (enhancing GOS classes) to copy/store documents in DMS.

There is no standard configuration to redirect GOS Create Attachment to DMS.

Therefore, the recommended and supported approach is to use Store Business Document or external archiving.

entry.title: Re: GOS attachment and KPRO
entry.content: GOS attachments are handled via SAPoffice/BDS and can be routed through KPro by configuring a Content Repository (OAC0). Once KPro is active and linked to the business object, attachments can be stored on an external content server instead of SOFFCONT1/SOC3.

entry.title: Re: How to Link Invoices for Journal Vouchers
entry.content: Solution: In SAP Business One, invoice amounts written off via Journal Entries should be cleared using Business Partner Internal Reconciliation. This properly links the invoice and JE, closes the invoice, and also updates INV6, ensuring aging and custom queries show correct outstanding balances.

entry.title: Re: External Storage for Business documents - Managing se...
entry.content:
When using External Storage / Content Server, failures during outages are not always visible to end users, especially for GOS attachments and background processes. Typically, issues can be traced via:

  • SLG1 (Object: BC_KPRO, ARCHIVELINK) for KPro/ArchiveLink errors

  • SOST / SOSTMON for outbound document failures (payment advices, outputs)

  • SM21 / ST22 for short dumps and system log entries

  • CCMS (RZ20) for Content Server availability monitoring

Failed attachments are usually not automatically retried. A common practice is to:

  • Implement custom logging or user exit checks for attachment creation

  • Monitor Content Server availability proactively and block attachment actions during outages

  • Provide a manual re‑attach/reprocess procedure for users once the server is back online

SAP does not provide a central retry queue for all business documents, so operational monitoring and user communication are key.

entry.title: Re: Remote client copy errors
entry.content:
These errors during remote client copy usually point to RFC/network interruptions or work process terminations, not table inconsistencies. The SM21 logs clearly show repeated “Connection lost” messages, which explains the read/conversion and program cancel errors.

Recommended actions:

  • Ensure stable network connectivity between PRD and QAS during the copy window.

  • Increase rdisp/max_wprun_time and verify enough dialog/background WPs.

  • Run Remote RFC Comparison in SCC8 before retrying.

  • If the client is large, prefer client export/import instead of remote copy.

Copying tables manually via transport is not recommended and may cause inconsistencies.

entry.title: Re: Performance Issues with RSBCS_REORG
entry.content:
Hi Manik,

Long runtime of RSBCS_REORG is a known issue. Please check SAP Note 1615366 – “RSBCS_REORG: Long runtime (SOMG)”.

In many systems, table SOMG contains entries with initial values in DOCTP, DOCYR, and DOCNO, which causes unnecessary database reads and leads to very long runtimes.

Recommended actions:

  • Implement SAP Note 1615366 via SNOTE, or

  • Apply the relevant Support Package that contains the correction.

  • After implementation, performance of RSBCS_REORG improves significantly.

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Problem with slow Unicode export
entry.content: The long Unicode export runtime is mainly due to the very large SOFFCONT1 table, which stores attachments as binary data. Deleting only a small percentage of entries usually does not significantly reduce export time. SAP generally recommends archiving or moving attachments to an external content server (ArchiveLink/KPro) before Unicode export, or getting SAP support guidance for table‑specific export optimization. In such cases, involving SAP (as you did) is the correct approach, since SOFFCONT1 handling during Unicode conversion is system‑ and DB‑specific.

entry.title: Re: unicode migration via socket
entry.content: We are using MigMon version <x.x> and R3load patch <yy>. Network is stable and socket prerequisites are met. Can you confirm which MigMon patch fixes the BUSY issue, or share the SAP Note number?

entry.title: Re: Where is the Offline form stored after its emailed ou...
entry.content: If ArchiveLink or external storage is not used, the submitted offline Adobe form is stored internally in SAP Office tables, mainly SOFFCONT1 (content) and related tables. The inbound email and processing details can be checked in SOST, while spool-related output (if generated) can be seen in SP01. Retrieval is possible but not user‑friendly without ArchiveLink; refer to SAP Note 904711 for storage and handling details.

entry.title: Re: Problem in SOST
entry.content: The main reason for slow SOST startup is usually large SAPoffice tables (SOFFCONT1, SOC3, ADRVP). Regular SAPoffice reorganization (e.g. RSBCS_REORG / SARA – SAP_BCS) should be scheduled by Basis. After cleanup, SOST performance improves significantly.

entry.title: Re: SAP Personas - table view on mobile
entry.content:
Unfortunately, increasing the number of rows in SAP GUI for HTML is not possible, because this is controlled by backend functionality. In general, the maxRows property of the table / grid can only be used to decrease the number of visible rows. If this is increased, it will be ignored, and the backend screen definition will determine how many rows are shown.

Different rules apply when rendering the table via Slipstream Engine. The maxRows property's effect is described in note 2557076. However, increasing the number of rows should only be used with display-only tables, as with editable tables this is likely to cause problems and in general, it doesn't seem to work properly. There are technical reasons why this is so.

entry.title: Re: SOLMAN_SETUPの管理対象システム設定について
entry.content: SOLMAN_SETUPで設定を更新することで、RFC宛先自動作成・更新とSU01ユーザ自動作成・更新以外に作成・更新されるトランザクションコードの設定があるかご教示いただきたいです。

entry.title: Re: FM to upload and read attachments in DMS
entry.content:
To upload and read documents in SAP DMS, you should use the standard DMS APIs instead of GOS.

For creating/uploading documents:

  • BAPI_DOCUMENT_CREATE2
    This is the recommended BAPI to create a DIR and upload originals.

  • Ensure KPro is correctly configured and the content repository is assigned.

  • Required RFC destinations:

    • SAPFTPA (FTP)

    • SAPHTTPA (HTTP)
      (Maintain them in SM59)

  • Files must be available on the application server (AL11), not a local PC for background processing.

For reading/displaying documents:

  • Use DMS APIs like:

    • CVAPI_DOC_GETDETAIL

    • CVAPI_DOC_CHECKOUTVIEW

    • CVAPI_DOC_FILE_READ

References:

  • SAP Note 504692

  • DMS API documentation on SAP Help

If the requirement is to attach documents to business objects (similar to GOS) but avoid SOFFCONT1, then DMS + KPro is the correct approach. Pure GOS attachments cannot be redirected to DMS without custom development.

entry.title: Re: How to create Dynamic dimension with Images stored in...
entry.content: In SAC, images cannot be consumed directly from SAP tables like SOFFCONT1 or from a Content Server via CDS as binary/BLOB fields. SAC dynamic images require a URL-based approach. The recommended solution is to expose the Business Partner logo via an HTTP-accessible endpoint (for example using ICF service, OData service, or SAP Content Server URL). In S/4HANA, you can create a CDS view that returns the Business Partner ID and the image URL (not the image itself). This CDS/OData service can then be consumed in SAC and used with the Dynamic Image feature by binding the image widget to the URL field. If logos are stored as GOS attachments, they must first be published to a content server or HTTP service; direct CDS consumption of SOFFCONT1 binary content is not supported in SAC.

entry.title: Re: SolMan HANA sizing
entry.content: Hi Arne, I’m also interested in how SolMan Service Desk attachments (SOFFCONT1 / CRMORDERCONT) are handled on HANA. Especially whether they are memory-resident or treated as LOBs and largely kept on disk / content server. If anyone has SAP notes or sizing experience, please share.

entry.title: Re: Redirecting documents to seperate Content Server
entry.content:
When you are providing a solution, workaround, explanation, or clear technical guidance that helps solve the question (even if it’s partial).
Example: explaining configuration steps, SAP Notes, tables, transactions, or confirming the root cause.

entry.title: Re: And an equally special thanks to aRS over in ABAP general
entry.content: Thanks for sharing this valuable insight. The explanation around SRGBTBREL and the relationship to SOFFCONT1 is extremely helpful, especially the GUID offset detail, which is often overlooked. This will definitely save time for anyone troubleshooting SAP Office and attachment relationships.

entry.title: Re: TABLE SPLITTING WITH SAPINST
entry.content:
Table splitting is fully supported by sapinst and Migration Monitor.

WHR files must be available before export starts and must be placed in the same export directory (…/ABAP/DATA) so that the same split definition is used during export and import.

You should use the same export directory for both phases. Sapinst will automatically recognize the split tables and generate multiple task (.TSK) files (create table, multiple load tasks, index creation).

Migration Monitor is started automatically by sapinst (NW 7.0 SR3+), so no manual start is required.

REPOLOAD does not need splitting (platform-specific), while SOFFCONT1 size should ideally be reduced beforehand using SAP Note 1634908.

entry.title: Re: Archiving Issue with these tables????
entry.content: Thanks for the references. These SAPoffice tables (SOFFCONT1, SOC3, SOOD, etc.) are not archived via standard Archiving Objects. Cleanup is done via reorganization reports like RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE / RSSORE00 and RSBCS_REORG as mentioned in the OSS notes.

entry.title: Re: CRM - RSSORE00
entry.content: RSSORE00 is an SAPoffice reorganization report used to delete obsolete SAPoffice objects such as sent emails, attachments, and temporary documents that are stored in tables like SOFFCONT1, SOOD, SOOS, etc. The table SOFFCONT1 stores the actual content (attachments) of SAPoffice documents and GOS attachments, which is why it often grows very large. SAP uses this table whenever attachments are created via SAPoffice, workflow, or GOS. There is no classic archiving object for SOFFCONT1; instead, cleanup is done via reorganization reports such as RSSORE00 / RSSO_DELETE_PRIVATE and related SAP Notes (for example, SAP Note 904711 explains where SAPoffice documents are physically stored). Regular housekeeping or moving attachments to an external content server is recommended to control database growth.

entry.title: Re: How to create storage area in cv01n
entry.content: Thanks Juan. This clarifies that CV01N originals are stored in SAP Office tables (SOFFCONT1) by default and that configuring SAP Content Server / ArchiveLink is required to store them externally.

entry.title: Re: Email Archiving for ERMS and Interaction Center in SAP CRM
entry.content:
ERMS work items are archived via standard workflow archiving using object WORKITEM in transaction SWW_SARA.
If no records are shown, please check that the ERMS workflows are completed and not in error status, and verify workflow runtime tables (SWWWIHEAD).
Also ensure KBA 2197465 prerequisites are fully implemented, as ERMS work items are only eligible for archiving after proper completion and deletion settings.

entry.title: Re: Migration Error - SQL1505 -Create unique index aborted on duplicate key
entry.content: Thanks for sharing this discussion. Issues around SOFFCONT1 growth, archiving, and migration (especially with ERMS / SAPoffice data) are still very relevant. Using KPRO with an external content server and following the recommended SAP Notes (e.g. 904711, 1634908, 2197465) seems to be the most sustainable approach to control database size and avoid migration issues. This thread is very helpful for anyone facing similar challenges.

entry.title: Re: TREX - Generic Object Services (GOS) - CV04N -Content Server
entry.content: Thanks for the explanation. In our case, GOS attachments are stored via document class SOFFPHIO (redirected to SOFFHTTP). However, SOFFPHIO cannot be indexed in SKPR07 and shows errors in SDOKPHTAB. Is it correct that GOS/SAPoffice documents are not TREX‑indexable, and that only DMS document classes (e.g. DMS_PCD1) support TREX full‑text search?

entry.title: Re: Default Public Layout in Fiori App
entry.content:
Hello @mohammed_mehebub ,

First try to solve it with your Fiori consultant; if it does not work, then raise a ticket with SAP. We faced such an issue, a few years ago, and it was solved by SAP.

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: Re: Remote Client copy
entry.content: These tables mainly store SAPoffice/attachment data (SOFF*). Performance and size issues are common—consider archiving (RSBCS_REORG / relevant SAP Notes) or moving attachments to an external Content Server (KPRO) to reduce load and improve copy/migration performance.

entry.title: Re: Download E-Mail + Attachment from CRM System to Local Harddrive
entry.content: We have a similar requirement to export CRM emails with attachments (including order reference) before system shutdown. If anyone has implemented a mass download solution or used a standard FM/class/report, please share your approach.

entry.title: Re: SAP Attachment Error: Due to document's naming conven...
entry.content:
Yes, linking SOFFPHIO to SOFFHTTP is mandatory when you want SAPoffice attachments to be stored on an external content server. The controlling configuration is done via KPRO Customizing (SKPR08 / SKPR07) and the tables SDOKPHCL (standard) and SDOKPHCL_C (customer override).

SDOKPHCL_C takes precedence over SDOKPHCL. If SOFFPHIO is not consistently mapped to SOFFHTTP in SDOKPHCL_C, attachments may still be processed via SOFFDB, causing errors—especially with filenames containing special characters (', ", etc.).

Special character issues are not caused by SOFFCONT1 directly, but by HTTP content server / KPRO encoding restrictions. Ensure:

  • Consistent mapping of SOFFPHIO → SOFFHTTP

  • Proper MIME type configuration

  • Latest SAP kernel and Content Server patches

As a workaround, avoid unsupported special characters or apply filename sanitization via BAdI/enhancement.

entry.title: Re: Date Issue within a Work Order Earliest & Latest finish dates
entry.content: It is happening with other orders also or only this one?

entry.title: Re: Saved attachments
entry.content: Thanks for the clarification. So attachment storage depends on SKPR08 settings (DB vs Content Server), and if stored in DB (SOFFCONT1) there’s no OS-level housekeeping—only careful SAPOffice reorganization programs apply.

entry.title: Re: Introduction to SAP Data Archiving
entry.content: “Very informative and well‑structured blog. This gives a clear end‑to‑end overview of SAP Data Archiving and its business benefits. Thanks for sharing!”

entry.title: AFO report is running long compared to underlying source BEx query
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a AFO report which is based on BEx report. I don't have a filter on Account Hierarchy in BEx and the report in RSRT is executing fine in expected time. However, when I am running the report, it is taking long runtime.

Any suggestion from the experts to improve the performance as business need this filter (exclusion of Unassingned account Hier node) and the report should perform as expected. 

Appreciate your swift response!

Kind Regards, Madhu Dosetty

entry.title: Re: Table splitting of REPOSRC for system copy
entry.content:
For R3ta table splitting, the split file format REPOSRC%10 is correct. The issue is the path. SAPINST expects the split file to be located inside the export directory (e.g. /usr/local/sap/Export/).
Run “Table Splitting Preparation” first – it should generate .WHR files under Export/ABAP/DATA. Once the .WHR files are created, proceed with the export.
If no .WHR files are generated, the split file path is still incorrect.

entry.title: Re: Long running homogenous Export -- stuck in Export ABAP phase
entry.content: This behavior is usually seen when very large tables (like SOFFCONT1 / SAPAPPL*) are still being exported. As long as the dump files are growing and R3load is running, the export is not stuck—it is still working. However, the repeated ORA‑01034 / DB connect errors indicate an unstable Oracle connection. Recommended actions: • Update R3load / R3trans to the latest patch • Run R3load -testconnect • Check Oracle alert log, processes, and memory limits • Ensure no DB restarts or listener interruptions For very large systems (800GB), long runtimes in the last ABAP export job are expected.

entry.title: Re: HANA Parameters to restrict Memory Usage
entry.content:
Memory shortages in SAP HANA cannot be solved only by setting statement_memory_limit parameters. These parameters only protect against single SQL statements and are not meant to control overall memory growth.

If tables like SEOCOMPODF, DD03L, DOKTL consume 40–50% memory even without active users, this usually points to:

  • Large dictionary / repository tables after upgrades or transports

  • Missing compression (column store tables not optimized)

  • Delta merge not performed

  • Row store fragmentation

Recommended actions:

  1. Follow SAP Note 1999997 completely (compression, cleanup, hybrid LOBs).

  2. Run table reorganization for row store tables (SAP Note 1813245).

  3. Trigger delta merge and compression for large column store tables.

  4. Check if the system is an ABAP system on HANA and ensure RS_B4HCON_CHECK_ENABLE recommendations are applied.

  5. Increasing memory should be the last option, only after cleanup and optimization.

Restarting HANA regularly is not a solution and indicates missing housekeeping or suboptimal configuration.

entry.title: Re: Heteregeneous copy with distribution monitor
entry.content: Great and very detailed documentation on heterogeneous system copy with DISTMON. Thanks for sharing practical tips on table splitting, Oracle PL/SQL splitter, and performance optimization—very helpful for large ECC migrations.

entry.title: Re: migration unicode Linux to unicode AIX
entry.content:
If the source system is already Unicode, you do not need to run a Unicode migration (SPUMG, UMG reset, etc.), even when moving from Linux (little endian) to AIX (big endian).

For a heterogeneous system copy (Unicode → Unicode):

  • Use standard system copy / heterogeneous migration via sapinst

  • Select Big Endian in sapinst for AIX

  • Use the correct target code page (4102) consistently

  • Ensure latest migration tools are used on the source system
    (R3load, R3ldctl, R3szchk, lib_dbsl)

The error
“(CNV) ERROR: There shall be only one Unicode in a database”
usually indicates a tool/codepage mismatch, not that another Unicode conversion is required.

No additional Unicode preparation steps are needed unless the source system is non‑Unicode.

entry.title: 免费交货销售订单业务scope item BDA

entry.title: Re: I could not use the Warly watch alert in sap for me
entry.content:
To request the necessary authorization, you can either contact a Super Administrator listed under Users & Contacts - SAP for Me associated with your customer number or utilize the self-service authorization feature per 2891528. 

For more detailed information on required authorizations for SAP EarlyWatch applications, please refer to KBA 2905076 - S-user ID authorizations required for SAP EarlyWatch applications -SAP for Me 

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

entry.title: Re: S4hana Group reporting 2021 Does it supports Equity m...
entry.content:
>Does it support Equity method?

Reclassification (Rule-based COI) for Equity Method is supported from S/4HANA 2022.  
Please refer to "Enhanced reclassification for equity method" section of the following blog.  
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-cloud-for-group-reporting-2202-is-live/ba-p/13529626
*The blog is for S/4HANA Public Cloud 2202, but the feature is included in S/4HANA OP/PCE 2022.

entry.title: Re: Welcome all SAP Community members, start here!
entry.content: Hi community members! It is great to meet and discuss in this group and be part of SAP.
